text: To enhance data integrity in cryogenic organ storage, implement a triple CRC32 checksum on combined RFID and temperature telemetry packets.
This redundancy ensures robust validation during transmission and mitigates silent corruption in high-noise environments.
Any organ bin exhibiting LN₂ probe temperature drift exceeding ±0.3 Kelvin from baseline must be auto-rejected to prevent transplant risk from thermal instability.
This integration ensures cross-platform compatibility without rewriting critical firmware logic, preserving backward compatibility while improving safety assurance.
